2022-11-18.name: Christmas by the Bay
2022-11-18.summary: There's a car parade Friday evening, followed by tree light, caroling and horse-drawn wagon rides. On Saturday, there's a parade at 10 a.m.

2022-11-18.name: Winterer's Gathering
2022-11-18.summary: There's a tent encampment, winter skills seminars, Arctic film festival and chili feed at the North House Folk School.

2022-11-18.name: Outdoor Adventure Expo
2022-11-18.summary: The expo at the Midwest Mountaineering store on the West Bank includes dozens of speakers and seminars about skiing, sled-dog racing and ice-climbing as well as camping, backpacking and other year-round adventures.

2022-11-18.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-11-18.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2022-11-18.name: Christkindlmarket Aurora
2022-11-18.summary: In the western suburbs, this new offshoot of the Chicago Christkindlmarket will be in RiverEdge Park on the Fox River.

2022-11-19.name: Magnificent Mile Lights Festival & Parade
2022-11-19.summary: There will be music and family activities on Michigan Avenue, with aÂ  lighted parade from Oak Street to Wacker Drive, followed by fireworks over the Chicago River.

2022-11-19.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2022-11-19.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-11-11.name: Gales of November
2022-11-11.summary: Listen to experts discuss Lake Superior shipwrecks and maritime history. There are social events, too, open to the public.

2022-11-12.name: Gales of November
2022-11-12.summary: Listen to experts discuss Lake Superior shipwrecks and maritime history. There are social events, too, open to the public.

2022-11-12.name: Trainfest
2022-11-12.summary: The nation's largest operating model railroad show includes more than 60 scenic railroads, clinics for hobbyists and many children's activities.

2022-11-12.name: Art on the Prairie
2022-11-12.summary: This free festival northwest of Des Moines showcases more than 100 Iowa artists, poets and musicians in seven venues, including the Hotel Pattee, in the downtown historic and cultural district. There will also be children's activities.

2022-11-13.name: Trainfest

2022-11-25.name: Free Entrance Day at Minnesota state parks
2022-11-25.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2022-11-25.name: Holiday Homecoming & Electric Parade
2022-11-25.summary: There will be a kickoff to the Holiday Tree Trail, a window-decorating contest and the Electric Christmas Parade.

2022-11-25.name: Holly Days
2022-11-25.summary: This Door County village offers horse-drawn wagon rides, a children's elf hunt and mistle dough contest and caroling.

2022-11-25.name: Door County Christkindlmarkt
2022-11-25.summary: This market on the grounds of the Corner of the Past Museum, a recreated pioneer homestead south of town, features local vendors and artisans, live music, and German dishes served inside a large barn.

2022-11-04.name: Art Attack
2022-11-04.summary: In the northeast arts district, 350 artists open their studios and offer demonstrations and workshops.Â

2022-11-05.name: Art Attack
2022-11-05.summary: In the northeast arts district, 350 artists open their studios and offer demonstrations and workshops.Â

2022-11-05.name: Veterans Day Parade
2022-11-05.summary: It's at 11 a.m., starting on Wisconsin Avenue, crossing the river and heading north on Water Street. After the parade, there's a festival at the Marcus Center, with music, entertainment and a veteran-owned market.

2022-11-10.name: Beacon lighting at Split Rock Lighthouse
2022-11-10.summary: This event, which commemorates the 1975 sinking of the ore freighter with 29 men, is the only time the             public can see the interior of the light tower when the beacon is lighted.
